expectations.text: An AGENTS.md file exists in the outputs directory
The file contains a section describing the project's directory structure
expectations.evidence: Repository Structure section (lines 18-33) with tree diagram and descriptions

expectations.text: The file includes build and test commands
expectations.evidence: Build and Development section with build, dev, database commands. Testing section (lines 81-89).

expectations.text: The file mentions the key technologies
expectations.evidence: Tech Stack section (lines 8-16): TypeScript, Express, Prisma, BullMQ/ioredis, Zod, Biome, Vitest

expectations.text: The file mentions database migration or seeding commands
expectations.evidence: Database Commands section (lines 71-77): db:migrate, db:seed, db:studio
138 lines â€” verbose, with separate headings and code blocks for each command

expectations.text: The file does not contain generic filler
expectations.evidence: Line 52: standalone 'npm install' code block. Line 58: 'npm run build' with 'This runs tsc to compile TypeScript to JavaScript' explanation. Line 66: 'npm run dev' with verbose description. Multiple obvious commands given their own headings.

expectations.text: Commands are formatted as bullet list items rather than headings with code blocks
expectations.evidence: Uses heading + code block format throughout: '### Install Dependencies' + code block, '### Build' + code block, '### Run in Development Mode' + code block

expectations.text: The file includes at least one project-specific gotcha or convention discovered from reading the source code
expectations.evidence: Line 38: sync-worker processes jobs 'inside a Prisma transaction'. Line 39: 'Singleton instances (Redis connection, Prisma client) shared across API and workers'. Architecture patterns surfaced from reading source.
